node.title: Thousands skip Northern Territory quarantine without paying
node.alt: Specialist health teams in protective gear walk through the Howard Springs quarantine facility.
node.description: The Northern Territory government is chasing an estimated $6.3 million from travellers who have not paid for their stay inÂ mandatory quarantine.
node.content:
["Thousands of travellers have left the Northern Territory's quarantine facilities without paying the fees required for the stay, with the outstanding accounts\u00a0so far adding up to\u00a0$6.3 million.", "Data provided by NT Health shows that, as at the end of September, there were 2,544 outstanding invoices\u00a0not paid, despite not having\u00a0agreed payment plans.", "The cost of 14 days of supervised quarantine is\u00a0$2,500 per individual or\u00a0$5,000 per family group of two or more people at the Territory's quarantine facilities in Darwin\u00a0and Alice Springs.", "Some travellers can apply\u00a0for a low-income discount on the fee, but the government also said some of the outstanding invoices could relate to larger groups, such as seasonal workers and overseas students.", "An NT Health spokesperson said\u00a0670 outstanding invoices have so far been referred for debt collection, with more in the process of referral.", "
Online forums discuss bids to challenge fees
", "Mandatory quarantine at the Northern Territory's government-run facilities is coming to an end, with the government announcing home quarantine for fully vaccinated travellers from November 23. There will be no fee for those completing home quarantine.", "However, among the tens of thousands of travellers who have arrived in the Northern Territory\u00a0on repatriation flights or from interstate hotspots to date, some have taken to social media to discuss ways to dodge or challenge their government-mandated quarantine\u00a0fee.\u00a0", "", "
Mandatory quarantine at the Northern Territory's government-run facilities will end on November 23.(AAP: Glenn Campbell)
", "One online group\u00a0dedicated to evading quarantine fees in Australia has more than 3,000\u00a0members, some\u00a0of whom have admitted\u00a0they stayed at quarantine\u00a0facilities in the Northern Territory\u00a0and do not want to pay their bills.", "The group's members argue\u00a0the fees are unreasonable\u00a0and that\u00a0it\u00a0was unfair of governments to make citizens pay to enter their own country.\u00a0\u00a0", "In August last year, Northern Territory\u00a0Chief Minister Michael Gunner told ABC Radio Darwin\u00a0the\u00a0$2,500 fee for individuals was not enough to cover two weeks of quarantine.\u00a0", "He said the total cost\u00a0was more like $3,300 to $3,400 per person.\u00a0", "In other states, such as\u00a0Victoria and New South Wales,\u00a0individuals have to\u00a0pay\u00a0$3,000 for a14-day\u00a0stay.", "
Legal expert\u00a0says grounds to challenge fees are slim
", "Professor Jeannie Paterson, a consumer protection law expert at the University of Melbourne, said there were very few legal avenues for people seeking to get out of paying for quarantine, although it was not\u00a0impossible.", "\"Effectively it's a contract.\u00a0So, if you stay at a 'hotel', you have to pay and if you don't pay, it's a breach of contract and you can go to court,\" she said.\u00a0", "\"The interesting thing is, [these people] didn't want to stay at the quarantine facility, but it was the condition of them coming back to Australia. They didn't have a totally free choice.\"\u00a0", "According to NT Health, people who are required to undertake mandatory quarantine are required to pay a \"statutory fee\".", "Professor Paterson said a statutory obligation \u2014 as in, a law made by parliament \u2014 was harder to fight than a contractual obligation.\u00a0", "\"If it's a contract,\u00a0you would've had to have to known the terms and conditions, and you would've had to agreed to those terms and conditions,\" she said.\u00a0", "In a statement to the ABC, an NT Health spokesperson said the government offered payment plans to people who were unable to pay the total amount in one transaction within 30 days of receiving their invoice after leaving quarantine.", "\"If a customer does not make contact with the Northern Territory government, or make any payment towards their invoice, the invoice is referred to debt collection if all avenues to assist the customer have been exhausted,\" the spokesperson said.", "After November 23, a reduced fee will be charged for people\u00a0without a suitable alternative place to quarantine to stay at the Northern Territory's\u00a0government-run facilities."]
